object_id.description: A uuid or otherwise unique identifier for this object.

persist.description: Persist this object in the database.

ttl.description: When applied to an entity, the entity will remove itself from DOM after the specified number of seconds. Update is allowed, which will reset the timer to start from that moment.

parent.description: Parent's object_id. Child objects inherit attributes of their parent, for example scale and translation.
parent.title: Parent

collision-listener.description: Name of the collision-listener, default can be empty string. Collisions trigger click events.
collision-listener.title: Collision Listener (legacy)

hide-on-enter-ar.description: Hide object when entering AR. Remove component to *not* hide.
hide-on-enter-ar.title: Hide in AR

hide-on-enter-vr.description: Hide object when entering VR. Remove component to *not* hide.
hide-on-enter-vr.title: Hide in VR

show-on-enter-ar.description: Show object when entering AR. Hidden otherwise.
show-on-enter-ar.title: Show in AR

show-on-enter-vr.description: Show object when entering VR. Hidden otherwise.
show-on-enter-vr.title: Show in VR

url.description: Use File Store paths under 'store/users/username', see CDN and other storage options in the description above.
url.title: Url

look-at.description: The look-at component defines the behavior for an entity to dynamically rotate or face towards another entity or position. Use '#my-camera' to face the user camera, otherwise can take either a vec3 position or a query selector to another entity.
look-at.title: Look At

buffer.description: Transform geometry into a BufferGeometry to reduce memory usage at the cost of being harder to manipulate (geometries only: box, circle, cone, ...).
buffer.title: Buffer

color.title: DEPRECATED (color)
color.description: DEPRECATED: data.color is deprecated for primitive geometry, use data.material.color instead.

screenshareable.description: Whether or not a user can screenshare on an object.
screenshareable.title: Screenshare-able

skipCache.description: Disable retrieving the shared geometry object from the cache. (geometries only: box, circle, cone, ...).
skipCache.title: Skip Cache

rotation.description: 3D object rotation in quaternion representation; Right-handed coordinate system. Euler degrees are deprecated in wire message format.
rotation.title: Rotation

animation.description: Animate and tween values. More properties at A-Frame Animation component. Easing properties are detailed at easings.net.

autoplay.description: Whether or not the animation should autoplay. Should be specified if the animation is defined for the animation-timeline component (currently not supported).

delay.description: How long (milliseconds) to wait before starting.

dir.description: Which dir to go from from to to.

dur.description: How long (milliseconds) each cycle of the animation is.

easing.description: Easing function of animation. To ease in, ease out, ease in and out. See easings.net for more.

elasticity.description: How much to bounce (higher is stronger).

enabled.description: If disabled, animation will stop and startEvents will not trigger animation start.

from.description: Initial value at start of animation. If not specified, the current property value of the entity will be used (will be sampled on each animation start). It is best to specify a from value when possible for stability.

isRawProperty.description: Flag to animate an arbitrary object property outside of A-Frame components for better performance. If set to true, for example, we can set property to like components.material.material.opacity. If property starts with components or object3D, this will be inferred to true.

loop.description: How many times the animation should repeat. If the value is true, the animation will repeat infinitely.

pauseEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger pause. Can be resumed with resumeEvents.

property.description: Property to animate. Can be a component name, a dot-delimited property of a component (e.g., material.color), or a plain attribute.

resumeEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger resume after pausing.

startEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger a restart and play. Animation will not autoplay if specified. startEvents will restart the animation, use pauseEvents to resume it. If there are other animation components on the entity animating the same property, those animations will be automatically paused to not conflict.

to.description: Target value at end of animation.

type.description: Right now only supports color for tweening isRawProperty color XYZ/RGB vector values.

animation.title: Animation

armarker.description: A location marker (such as an AprilTag, a lightAnchor, or an UWB tag), used to anchor scenes, or scene objects, in the real world.

publish.title: publish
publish.description: Publish detections. Send detections to external agents (e.g. external builder script that places new markers in the scene). If dynamic=true and publish=true, object position is not updated (left up to external agent).

buildable.title: buildable
buildable.description: Whether tag has 'dynamic' toggled on click. Used to position a tag, then lock into position.

dynamic.title: dynamic
dynamic.description: Dynamic tag, not used for localization. E.g., to move object to which this ARMarker component is attached to. Requires permissions to update the scene (if dynamic=true).

markerid.title: markerid
markerid.description: The marker id (e.g. for AprilTag 36h11 family, an integer in the range [0, 586]).

armarker.title: ARMarker

click-listener.description: Object will listen for mouse events like clicks.
click-listener.title: Click Listener

enabled.description: Publish events, set false to disable.

bubble.description: Set false to prevent click events from bubbling up to parent objects. See Event Bubbling.

box-collision-listener.description: Listen for bounding-box collisions with user camera and hands. Must be applied to an object or model with geometric mesh. Collisions are determined by course bounding-box overlaps.
box-collision-listener.title: Box Collision Listener

dynamic.description: Set true for a moving object, which should have its bounding box recalculated regularly to determine proper collision.

blip.description: When the object is created or deleted, it will animate in/out of the scene instead of appearing/disappearing instantly. Must have a geometric mesh.
blip.title: Blip Effect

blipin.description: Animate in on create, set false to disable.

blipout.description: Animate out on delete, set false to disable.

planes.description: Which which clipping planes to use for effect. A top plane clips above it, bottom clips below it.

applyDescendants.description: Apply blipout effect to include all descendents. Does not work for blipin.

static-body.description: A fixed-position or animated object. Other objects may collide with static bodies, but static bodies themselves are unaffected by gravity and collisions. More properties at A-Frame Physics System.

shape.description: Body components will attempt to find an appropriate CANNON.js shape to fit your model. When defining an object you may choose a shape or leave the default, auto. Select a shape carefully, as there are performance implications with different choices.

cylinderAxis.description: Override default axis of bounding cylinder. Requires shape:cylinder.

sphereRadius.description: Override default radius of bounding sphere. Requires shape:sphere. NaN by default.

type.description: Define the result of collisions. Dynamic can be moved, Static cannot be moved.

static-body.title: Physics Static Body

dynamic-body.description: A freely-moving object. Dynamic bodies have mass, collide with other objects, bounce or slow during collisions, and fall if gravity is enabled. More properties at A-Frame Physics System.

shape.description: Body components will attempt to find an appropriate CANNON.js shape to fit your model. When defining an object you may choose a shape or leave the default, auto. Select a shape carefully, as there are performance implications with different choices.

cylinderAxis.description: Override default axis of bounding cylinder. Requires shape:cylinder.

sphereRadius.description: Override default radius of bounding sphere. Requires shape:sphere. NaN by default.

type.description: Define the result of collisions. Dynamic can be moved, Static cannot be moved.

dynamic-body.title: Physics Dynamic Body

goto-landmark.description: Teleports user to the landmark with the given name. Requires click-listener.

landmark.description: Id of landmark to teleport to.

goto-landmark.title: Goto Landmark

goto-url.description: Load new URL when object is clicked. Requires click-listener.

on.description: A case-sensitive string representing the event type to listen for. See Web Events.

goto-url.title: Goto URL

impulse.description: Apply an impulse to an object to set it in motion. This happens in conjunction with an event. Requires click-listener and physics.
impulse.title: Impulse

landmark.title: Landmark
landmark.description: Define entities as a landmark; Landmarks appears in the landmark list and you can move (teleport) to them; You can define the behavior of the teleport: if you will be at a fixed or random distance, looking at the landmark, fixed offset or if it is constrained by a navmesh (when it exists).

randomRadiusMin.description: Minimum radius from the landmark to teleport to. (randomRadiusMax must > 0).

randomRadiusMax.description: Maximum radius from the landmark to teleport to.

offsetPosition.description: Use as a static teleport x,y,z offset.

startingPosition.description: Set to true to use this landmark as a scene start (spawn) position. If several landmarks with startingPosition=true exist in a scene, one will be randomly selected.

lookAtLandmark.description: Set to true to make users face the landmark when teleported to it.

label.description: Landmark description to display in the landmark list.

material-extras.description: Define extra material properties, namely texture encoding, whether to render the material's color and render order. The properties set here access directly Three.js material component. More properties at THREE.js Material.

overrideSrc.description: Overrides the material source in all meshes of an object (e.g. a basic shape or a GLTF); Use, for example, to change the texture of a GLTF.

colorWrite.description: Whether to render the material's color.

renderOrder.description: Allows the default rendering order of scene graph objects to be overridden.

transparentOccluder.description: If `true`, will set `colorWrite=false` and `renderOrder=0` to make the material a transparent occluder.

gltfOpacity.description: Opacity value to apply to the model. 1 is fully opaque, 0 is fully transparent.

material-extras.title: Material extras

shadow.title: Shadow
shadow.description: The shadow component enables shadows for an entity and its children. Adding the shadow component alone is not enough to display shadows in your scene. We must have at least one light with castShadow: true enabled.

cast.description: Whether the entity casts shadows onto the surrounding scene.
cast.title: cast shadow

receive.description: Whether the entity receives shadows from the surrounding scene.
receive.title: receive shadow

sound.description: The sound component defines the entity as a source of sound or audio. The sound component is positional and is thus affected by the component's position. More properties at A-Frame Sound.

autoplay.description: Whether to automatically play sound once set.

loop.description: Whether to loop the sound once the sound finishes playing.

maxDistance.description: Maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.

on.description: An event for the entity to listen to before playing sound.

poolSize.description: Numbers of simultaneous instances of this sound that can be playing at the same time.

positional.description: Whether or not the audio is positional (movable).

refDistance.description: Reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.

rolloffFactor.description: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener.

src.description: URL path to sound file e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/sound/wave.mp3'.

volume.description: How loud to play the sound.

sound.title: Positional Sound

textinput.title: Text Input
textinput.description: Opens an HTML prompt when clicked. Sends text input as an event on MQTT. Requires click-listener.

on.description: A case-sensitive string representing the event type to listen for. See Web Events

remote-render.description: Whether or not an object should be remote rendered [Experimental].
remote-render.title: Remote Render

video-control.description: Adds a video to an entity and controls its playback.

frame_object.description: URL of a thumbnail image, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/conix-face-white.jpg'.

video_object.description: Name of object where to put the video, e.g. 'square_vid6'.

video_path.description: URL of the video file, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/videos/kungfu.mp4'.

anyone_clicks.description: Responds to clicks from any user.

cleanup.description: Automatically remove HTML5 video and img assets from DOM on object removal.

video-control.title: Video

attribution.description: Attribution Component. Saves attribution data in any entity.

extractAssetExtras.description: Extract attribution info from asset extras; will override attribution info given (default: true).

attribution.title: Attribution

spe-particles.description: GPU based particle systems in A-Frame. More properties at A-Frame SPE Particles component.

acceleration.description: For sphere and disc distributions, only the x axis is used.

accelerationDistribution.description: Distribution of particle acceleration, for disc and sphere, only the x component will be used. if set to NONE use the 'distribution' attribute for accelerationDistribution.

accelerationSpread.description: Spread of the particle's acceleration. for sphere and disc distributions, only the x axis is used.

activeMultiplier.description: Multiply the rate of particles emission, if larger than 1 then the particles will be emitted in bursts. note, very large numbers will emit all particles at once.

affectedByFog.description: If true, the particles are affected by THREE js fog.

alphaTest.description: Alpha values below the alphaTest threshold are considered invisible.

angle.description: 2D rotation of the particle over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

angleSpread.description: Spread in angle over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

color.description: Array of colors over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

colorSpread.description: Spread to apply to colors, spread an array of vec3 (r g b) with 0 for no spread. note the spread will be re-applied through-out the lifetime of the particle.

depthTest.description: If true, don't render a particle's pixels if something is closer in the depth buffer.

depthWrite.description: If true, particles write their depth into the depth buffer. this should be false if we use transparent particles.

direction.description: Make the emitter operate forward or backward in time.

distribution.description: Distribution for particle positions, velocities and acceleration. will be overridden by specific '...Distribution' attributes.

drag.description: Apply resistance to moving the particle, 0 is no resistance, 1 is full resistance, particle will stop moving at half of it's maxAge.

dragSpread.description: Spread to apply to the drag attribute.

duration.description: Duration of the emitter (seconds), if less than 0 then continuously emit particles.

emitterScale.description: Global scaling factor for all particles from the emitter.

enableInEditor.description: Enable the emitter while the editor is active (i.e. while scene is paused).

hasPerspective.description: If true, particles will be larger the closer they are to the camera.

maxAge.description: Maximum age of a particle before reusing.

opacity.description: Opacity over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

opacitySpread.description: Spread in opacity over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

particleCount.description: Maximum number of particles for this emitter.

positionDistribution.description: Distribution of particle positions, disc and sphere will use the radius attributes. For box particles emit at 0,0,0, for sphere they emit on the surface of the sphere and for disc on the edge of a 2D disc on the XY plane.

positionOffset.description: Fixed offset to the apply to the emitter relative to its parent entity.

positionSpread.description: Particles are positioned within +- of these local bounds. for sphere and disc distributions only the x axis is used.

radius.description: Radius of the disc or sphere emitter (ignored for box). note radius of 0 will prevent velocity and acceleration if they use a sphere or disc distribution.

radiusScale.description: Scales the emitter for sphere and disc shapes to form oblongs and ellipses.

randomizeAcceleration.description: If true, re-randomize acceleration when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeAngle.description: If true, re-randomize angle when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeColor.description: If true, re-randomize colour when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeDrag.description: If true, re-randomize drag when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeOpacity.description: If true, re-randomize opacity when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizePosition.description: If true, re-randomize position when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeRotation.description: If true, re-randomize rotation when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeSize.description: If true, re-randomize size when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

randomizeVelocity.description: If true, re-randomize velocity when re-spawning a particle, can incur a performance hit.

relative.description: World relative particles move relative to the world, while local particles move relative to the emitter (i.e. if the emitter moves, all particles move with it).

rotationAxisSpread.description: Variance in the axis of rotation.

rotationStatic.description: If true, the particles are fixed at their initial rotation value. if false, the particle will rotate from 0 to the 'rotation' value.

size.description: Array of sizes over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

sizeSpread.description: Spread in size over the particle's lifetime, max 4 elements.

texture.description: Texture to be used for each particle, may be a spritesheet.  Examples: [blob.png, fog.png, square.png, explosion_sheet.png, fireworks_sheet.png], like path 'static/images/textures/blob.png'.

textureFrameCount.description: Number of frames in the spritesheet, negative numbers default to textureFrames.x * textureFrames.y.

textureFrameLoop.description: Number of times the spritesheet should be looped over the lifetime of a particle.

textureFrames.description: X and Y frames for a spritesheet. each particle will transition through every frame of the spritesheet over its lifetime (see textureFramesLoop).

useTransparency.description: Should the particles be rendered with transparency?

velocity.description: For sphere and disc distributions, only the x axis is used.

velocityDistribution.description: Distribution of particle velocities, for disc and sphere, only the x component will be used. if set to NONE use the 'distribution' attribute for velocityDistribution.

wiggle.description: Extra distance the particle moves over its lifetime.

spe-particles.title: SPE Particles

jitsi-video.description: Apply a jitsi video source to the geometry.
jitsi-video.title: Jitsi Video

jitsiId.description: JitsiId of the video source; If defined will override displayName.

displayName.description: ARENA or Jitsi display name of the video source; Will be ignored if jitsiId is given. (* change requires reload* ).

material.description: The material properties of the object's surface. More properties at A-Frame Material.

anisotropy.description: The anisotropic filtering sample rate to use for the textures. A value of 0 means the default value will be used, see renderer.

blending.description: The blending mode for the material's RGB and Alpha sent to the WebGLRenderer.

combine.description: How the environment map mixes with the material. Requires shader: phong.

depthTest.description: Whether depth testing is enabled when rendering the material.

dithering.description: Whether material is dithered with noise. Removes banding from gradients like ones produced by lighting.

emissive.description: The color of the emissive lighting component. Used to make objects produce light even without other lighting in the scene. Requires shader: standard or phong

emissiveIntensity.description: Intensity of the emissive lighting component. Requires shader: standard or phong

fog.description: Whether or not material is affected by fog.

height.description: Height of video (in pixels), if defining a video texture. Requires shader: standard or flat.

metalness.description: How metallic the material is from 0 to 1. Requires shader: standard.

opacity.description: Extent of transparency. If the transparent property is not true, then the material will remain opaque and opacity will only affect color.

reflectivity.description: How much the environment map affects the surface. Requires shader: phong.

refract.description: Whether the defined envMap should refract. Requires shader: phong.

refractionRatio.description: 1/refractive index of the material. Requires shader: phong.

repeat.description: How many times a texture (defined by src) repeats in the X and Y direction.

roughness.description: How rough the material is from 0 to 1. A rougher material will scatter reflected light in more directions than a smooth material. Requires shader: standard.

shader.description: Which material to use. Defaults to the standard material. Can be set to the flat material or to a registered custom shader material.

shininess.description: How shiny the specular highlight is; a higher value gives a sharper highlight. Requires shader: phong.

side.description: Which sides of the mesh to render.

specular.description: This defines how shiny the material is and the color of its shine. Requires shader: phong.

src.description: URI, relative or full path of an image/video file. e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/360falls.mp4'.

toneMapped.description: Whether to ignore toneMapping, set to false you are using renderer.toneMapping and an element should appear to emit light. Requires shader: flat.

transparent.description: Whether material is transparent. Transparent entities are rendered after non-transparent entities.

vertexColorsEnabled.description: Whether to use vertex or face colors to shade the material.

visible.description: Whether material is visible. Raycasters will ignore invisible materials.

width.description: Width of video (in pixels), if defining a video texture. Requires shader: standard or flat.

wireframe.description: Whether to render just the geometry edges.

wireframeLinewidth.description: Width in px of the rendered line.

material.title: Material

multisrc.description: Define multiple visual sources applied to an object.

srcs.description: A comma-delimited list if URIs, e.g. 'side1.png, side2.png, side3.png, side4.png, side5.png, side6.png' (required).

srcspath.description: URI, relative or full path of a directory containing srcs, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/dice/' (required).

multisrc.title: Multi Source
